verses.text: Gather together His saints unto Him, those who arrange His covenant with sacrifices.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:9
verses.text: And the heavens shall announce His righteousness, for God is the judge".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:10
verses.text: Also in Isaiah: "The Lord God of strength shall go forth, and shall break war in pieces: He shall stir up contest, and shall cry over His enemies with strength.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:11
verses.text: I have been silent; shall I always be silent?" Also in the sixty-seventh Psalm: "Let God arise, and let His enemies be scattered: and let those who hate Him flee from His face.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:12
verses.text: As smoke vanisheth, let them vanish: as wax melteth from the face of fire, thus let the sinners perish from the face of God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:13
verses.text: And let the righteous be glad and rejoice in the sight of God: and let them be glad with joyfulness.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:14
verses.text: Sing unto God, sing praises unto His name: make a way to Him who goeth up into the west.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:15
verses.text: God is His name.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:16
verses.text: They shall be put to confusion from the face of Him who is the Father of the orphans, and the Judge of the widows.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:17
verses.text: God is in His holy place: God, who maketh men to dwell with one mind in an house, bringing forth them that are bound with might, and equally those who provoke unto anger, who dwell in the sepulchres: God, when Thou wentest forth in the sight of Thy people, in passing into the desert".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:18
verses.text: Also in the eighty-first Psalm: "Arise, O God; judge the earth: for Thou wilt exterminate among all nations".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:19
verses.text: Also in the Gospel according to Matthew: "What have we to do with Thee, Thou Son of David? why art Thou come hither to punish us before the time?" Likewise according to John: "The Father judgeth nothing, but hath given all judgment to the Son, that all may honour the Son as they honour the Father.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:20
verses.text: He that honoureth not the Son, honoureth not the Father who hath sent Him".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 29:21
verses.text: So too in the second Epistle of Paul to the Corinthians: "We must all appear before the judgment-seat of Christ, that every one may bear the things proper to his body, according to those things which he hath done, whether they be good or evil".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:1
verses.text: That He will reign as a King for ever.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:2
verses.text: In Zechariah: "Tell ye the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy King cometh unto thee: just, and having salvation; meek, sitting upon an ass that hath not been tamed".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:3
verses.text: Also in Isaiah: "Who will declare to you that eternal place? He that walketh in righteousness, and holdeth back his hands from gifts; stopping his ears that he may not hear the judgment of blood; and closing his eyes, that he may not see unrighteousness: this man shall dwell in the lofty cavern of the strong rock; bread shall be given him, and his water shall be sure.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:4
verses.text: Ye shall see the King with glory".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:5
verses.text: Likewise in Malachi: "I am a great King, saith the Lord, and my name is illustrious among the nations".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:6
verses.text: Also in the second Psalm: "But I am established as a King by Him upon His holy hill of Zion, announcing His empire".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:7
verses.text: Also in the twenty-first Psalm: "All the ends of the world shall be reminded, and shall turn to the Lord: and all the countries of the nations shall worship in Thy sight.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:8
verses.text: For the kingdom is the Lord's: and He shall rule over all nations".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:9
verses.text: Also in the twenty-third Psalm: "Lift up your gates, ye princes; and be ye lifted up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:10
verses.text: Who is this King of glory? The Lord strong and mighty, the Lord strong in battle.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:11
verses.text: Lift up your gates, O ye princes; and be ye lifted up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:12
verses.text: Who is this King of glory? The Lord of hosts, He is the King of glory".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:13
verses.text: Also in the forty-fourth Psalm: "My heart hath breathed forth a good discourse: I tell my works to the king: my tongue is the pen of a writer intelligently writing.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:14
verses.text: Thou art lovely in beauty above the children of men: grace is shed forth on Thy lips, because God hath blessed Thee for ever.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:15
verses.text: Be girt with Thy sword on Thy thigh, O most mighty.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:16
verses.text: To Thy honour and to Thy beauty both attend, and direct Thyself, and reign, because of truth, and meekness, and righteousness".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:17
verses.text: Also in the fifth Psalm: "My King, and my God, because unto Thee will I pray.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:18
verses.text: O Lord, in the morning Thou shalt hear my voice; in the morning I will stand before Thee, and will contemplate Thee".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:19
verses.text: Also in the ninety-sixth Psalm: "The Lord hath reigned; let the earth rejoice; let the many isles be glad".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:20
verses.text: Moreover, in the forty-fourth Psalm: "The queen stood at thy right hand in a golden garment; she is clothed in many colours.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:21
verses.text: Hear, O daughter, and see, and incline thine ear, and forget thy people and thy father's house; for the King hath desired thy beauty, for He is thy Lord God".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:22
verses.text: Also in the seventy-third Psalm: "But God is our King before the world; He hath wrought salvation in the midst of the earth".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:23
verses.text: Also in the Gospel according to Matthew: "And when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judah in the days of Herod the king, behold, Magi from the east came to Jerusalem, saying, Where is He who is born King of the Jews? for we have seen His star in the east, and have come to worship Him".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:24
verses.text: Also, according to John, Jesus said: "My kingdom is not of this world.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:25
verses.text: If my kingdom were of this world, my servants would be in trouble, that I should not be delivered to the Jews; but now is my kingdom not from hence.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:26
verses.text: Pilate said, Art thou a king, then? Jesus answered, Thou sayest that I am a king.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:27
verses.text: For this cause I was born, and for this cause I am come into the world, that I might bear testimony to the truth.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 30:28
verses.text: Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice".

chapters.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:1
verses.text: That He Himself is both Judge and King.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:2
verses.text: In the seventy-first Psalm: "O God, give Thy judgment to the king, and Thy righteousness to the king's son, to judge Thy people in righteousness".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:3
verses.text: Also in the Apocalypse: "And I saw the heaven opened, and behold a white horse; and He who sate upon him was called Faithful and True; and He judgeth justice and righteousness, and maketh war.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:4
verses.text: And His eyes were, as it were, a flame of fire, and upon His head were many crowns; and He bare a name written that was known to none other than Himself: and He was clothed with a garment sprinkled with blood, and His name is called the Word of God.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:5
verses.text: And the armies which are in heaven followed Him on white horses, clothed in linen white and clean.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:6
verses.text: And out of His mouth went forth a sword with two edges, that with it He should smite the nations, which He shall shepherd with a rod of iron; and He shall tread the winepress of the wrath of God Almighty.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:7
verses.text: Also He has on His garment and on His thigh the name written, King of kings, and Lord of lords".

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:8
verses.text: Likewise in the Gospel: "When the Son of man shall come in His glory, and all the angels with Him, then He shall sit in the throne of His glory; and all nations shall be gathered together before Him, and He shall separate them one from another, even as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats; and He shall place the sheep at His right hand, but the goats at His left hand.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:9
verses.text: Then shall the King say unto them who shall be at His right hand, Come, ye blessed of my Father, receive the kingdom which is prepared for you from the beginning of the world: for I was hungry, and ye gave me to eat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me to drink: I was a stranger, and ye received me: naked, and ye clothed me: sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:10
verses.text: Then shall the righteous answer, and say unto Him, Lord, when saw we Thee hungry, and fed Thee? thirsty, and gave Thee to drink? And when saw we Thee a stranger, and received Thee? naked, and clothed Thee? And when saw we Thee sick, and in prison, and came unto Thee? And the King, answering, shall say unto them, Verily I say unto you, In as far as ye have done it to the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:11
verses.text: Then shall He say unto them who shall be on His left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, which my Father hath prepared for the devil and his angels: for I have been hungry, and ye gave me not to eat: I have been thirsty, and ye gave me not to drink: I was a stranger, and ye received me not: naked, and ye clothed me not: sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:12
verses.text: Then shall they also answer and say, Lord, when saw we Thee hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and have not ministered unto Thee? And He shall answer unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye have not done it to one of the least of these, ye have not done it unto me.

verses.name: Cyprian: Against the Jews Book II 31:13
verses.text: And these shall go away into everlasting burning, but the righteous into life eternal".
